page.title: 13The Market Square
page.content: { The Market Square-Market Bosworth {_________________________________ In{1285}King Edward I granted the Harcourt family "A weekly market on Wednesday,and a fair on the eve,day and morrow of St. Peter and St. Paul,at their manor of Bosworth."This market still survives and is a very important feature of the area.The market is situated in the cobbled square surrounded by old houses,weaver's cottages and shops.Some of the shops are in the old Wheatsheaf Courtyard including "The Bookworm",a travel agents and a wool shop. The Wednesday market attracts shoppers from the outlying villages who are bussed in.Many shopkeepers are not happy about the market because they think it takes away their trade but the shoppers are very happy with it.
